CNF. ]jQRID DELEGATES ON LAGUAIDIA.JfiMOr-IAL.IES
Former FCC Commissioner Clifford Durr; N-A-E-B secretary Morris Novikj^and
Saul Carson of the "New Republic" were anong the party which left New Yo:
in mid-August to participate in a series of dedications of memorials to
New York's late mayor, Fiorello LaGuardia in four different European coun¬
tries! The dedication will include a library in Warsaw a public square m
Lyon, France, a school in Prague, and a hospital in Italy.
SLOAN FOUNDATION TO OFFER RADIO. AIIALDS
The Alfred P Sloan foundation, Inc., is to offer recognition for outstanding
radit public service" programs in the field of highway safety. The announcement
made by Arnold J. tocher, executive director of the Foundation, stated the
nuroose was two-folds to pay tribute to the nation's broadcasters for bh i
contributions to highway safety and to stimulate greater participation in th
future#
"The Foundation", he said, "believes radio has and will continue to play an
important part in promoting highway safety."
